download

Summary
I am used to manage file downloads to the client browser. When the client requests a download, the server first prepares and saves the requested download. The client is then shown a dialog and prompted to download the file. The mechanism for downloading files through the browser is not directly compatible with our AJAX approach to a single page application, but this two part approach lets us manage it fairly cleanly.

max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		This is used a the title in auditLogs. This should NEVER be null.

  		The created timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.

  		The time this record was originally created.

fileName  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		  The name of the file to be downloaded. This is only used if the type is File.  
lockVersion  lockVersion required
audit disabled   		This is used to coordinate optimistic locking in the database. This is usually not displayed.  
name  fileName
max length: 255
allows printable 		required
  		The display name of this download. This is used for all types of download. In particular, note that the Name may not match the name of the file and/or attachment.  
typeCode  longEnumCode
max length: 30
allows letters
allows digits
allows symbols 		required
enum
  		The type of download.

File, use the local file system.

Attachment, use the specified attachment.

Bytes, use the byte data stored dirctly in this record.  
typeName  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		abstract
  		The type of download.

File, use the local file system.

Attachment, use the specified attachment.

Bytes, use the byte data stored dirctly in this record.  
uid  uid
max length: 30
allows printable 		primary key
required
  		The global unique key. This is a large hex-encoded number, and is usually not displayed to users. This is currently NOT a standard format, but is instead a format that we use internally.  


Associations
Name Type Attributes Description
attachment  attachment   The attachment to be downloaded. This is only used if the type is attachment. The binary content is provided by the attachment record.  
user  user required
  		The specific user allowed to download this file.
